definition: The correct value is not known to, and not computable by, the creator of this information. However, a correct value probably exists.
label: unknown

definition: A platform located on the solid surface of the Earth either above or below sea level.
label: land or seafloor

definition: A collection of oceanographic instruments mounted at a fixed position on the seabed (e.g. POL Monitoring Platform, seabed ADCP).
label: fixed benthic node

definition: An instrumented platform that is propelled on wheels or tracks on the seabed (e.g benthic crawler).
label: sea bed vehicle

definition: A structure to which instrumentation may be attached that is either in air or under water depending on the state of the tide and weather conditions.
label: beach/intertidal zone structure

definition: A fixed man-made structure on land to which instrumentation may be attached (e.g. meteorological tower).
label: land/onshore structure

definition: An instrumented vehicle or sample collector that operates on the solid surface of the Earth (e.g. mobile meteorological station, land crawler, snowmobile).
label: land/onshore vehicle

definition: A fixed (for the duration of the measurements) man-made structure away from the coast to which instrumentation may be attached (e.g. oil rig, gas rig or jack-up barge).
label: offshore structure

definition: A fixed man-made structure permanently linked to land with access to water at all states of the tide to which instrumentation may be attached (e.g. pier).
label: coastal structure

definition: An instrumented structure in a river upstream of its tidal limit.
label: river station

definition: A large polythene bag containing a water sample suspended in the natural environment so that it shares ambient physical conditions such as temperature and light levels, but is chemically isolated to allow experiments such as fertilisation.
label: mesocosm bag

definition: A platform operating within a water body.
label: submersible

definition: A platform operating in the water column that has both self-contained propulsion and at least one human operator on board (e.g. submarine).
label: propelled manned submersible

definition: A platform operating in the water column attached to a mothership by an umbilical with limited propulsion and no human operator on board (e.g. ROV).
label: propelled unmanned submersible

definition: A vehicle towed by rigid cable through the water column at fixed or varying depth with no propulsion and no human operator (e.g. Towfish, Scanfish, UOR, SeaSoar).
label: towed unmanned submersible

definition: A platform operating in the water column attached to a mothership by an umbilical but with no means of propulsion that has at least one human operator on board (e.g. bathysphere).
label: drifting manned submersible

definition: A free-roving platform operating in the water column with propulsion but no human operator on board (e.g. Autosub, Gavia).
label: autonomous underwater vehicle

definition: An unmanned platform lowered and raised vertically by a cable from the mothership.  Includes any type of profiling sensor mounting such as CTD frames, profiling radiometers and instrumented nets.
label: lowered unmanned submersible

definition: Platforms with buoyancy-based propulsion that are capable of operations at variable depths which are not constrained to be near the sea surface.
label: sub-surface gliders

definition: A large platform operating on the surface of the water column. Objective definitions for guidelines: >50m length (EU), >100 foot length (USA), >300 GRT weight (SOLAS). Subjective definition: a ship is a vessel big enough to carry a boat.
label: ship

definition: A platform of any size operating on the surface of the water column in unpredictable locations that is specifically equipped, manned and operated for scientific, usually oceanographic, research.
label: research vessel

definition: A platform for purpose of commerce of any size operating on the surface of the water column in unpredictable locations that regularly collects scientific (oceanographic and meteorological) data (e.g. an instrumented cargo vessel).
label: vessel of opportunity

definition: A small self-propelled platform operating on the surface of the water column that may be easily removed from the water (e.g. shore-based RIBs, ships' boats).
label: self-propelled small boat

definition: A platform of any size occupying a fixed location on the surface of the water column for prolonged periods collecting scientific (oceanographic and meteorological) data as a primary or secondary mission.  Includes light vessels and weather ships.
label: vessel at fixed position

definition: A platform repeatedly following a predictable fixed track on the surface of the water column that collects scientific (oceanographic and meteorological) data (e.g. an instrumented ferry).
label: vessel of opportunity on fixed route

definition: A platform operating on the surface of the water column whose primary purpose is the commercial harvesting of fish or shellfish but may be engaged in scientific activities such as fish stock surveys or mooring deployments and recoveries.
label: fishing vessel

definition: A small self-propelled platform operating on the surface of the water column in unpredictable locations that is smaller than a ship, but too large to easily remove from the water.
label: self-propelled boat

definition: A platform operating on the surface of the water column that is manually propelled and may not be easily removed from the water (e.g. trireme).
label: man-powered boat

definition: A platform operating on the surface of the water column in unpredictable locations that is primarily equipped, manned and operated for military purposes.  Includes surface warships of all sizes and logistic support vessels.
label: naval vessel

definition: A platform operating on the surface of the water column that is manually propelled and may be easily removed from the water (e.g. rowing boat, canoe).
label: man-powered small boat

definition: A self-propelled vehicle operating on the sea surface with no human occupants.
label: autonomous surface water vehicle

definition: Platforms operating at a single depth near the sea surface, using a combination of solar energy and wave motion as means of propulsion.
label: surface gliders

definition: A drillship is a merchant vessel designed for use in exploratory offshore drilling of new oil and gas wells or for scientific drilling purposes.
label: drillship

definition: A mobile platform with propulsion operating on and restricted to the surface of a water body.
label: surface vessel

definition: An unmanned instrumented platform operating on the surface of the water column loosely tethered to the seafloor to maintain a fixed position (e.g. ODAS buoy).
label: moored surface buoy

definition: An unmanned instrumented platform operating on the surface of the water column often attached to a drogue to track currents rather than winds (e.g. Argos buoy).
label: drifting surface float

definition: A collection of oceanographic instruments attached to wires suspended between anchors on the seabed and buoyant spheres in the water column.
label: subsurface mooring

definition: An unmanned instrumented platform drifting freely in the water column at a depth governed by its density (e.g. Swallow float).
label: drifting subsurface float

definition: A platform that periodically makes an automated vertical traverse of the water column at a predetermined fixed location. (e.g. YSI vertical profiler, HOMER CTD).
label: fixed subsurface vertical profiler

definition: An unmanned instrumented platform drifting freely in the water column that periodically makes vertical traverses through the water column (e.g. Argo float).
label: drifting subsurface profiling float

definition: A free-floating platform either on the surface of the water column or at a predetermined depth within the water column.
label: float

definition: A tethered collection of oceanographic instruments at a fixed location that may include seafloor, mid-water and surface components.
label: mooring

definition: An undrogued (i.e. no sub-surface parachute) surface float that is deployed in regions where sea ice forms that moves with either ice or water depending upon the time of year.
label: surface ice buoy

definition: A platform that periodically makes an automated vertical traverse of the water column that is fixed to a floating body of ice.
label: Ice-tethered subsurface profiling float

definition: A platform capable of flight in the atmosphere because it is lighter than air.
label: buoyant aircraft

definition: A container filled with a gas that is lighter than air, which is constrained to rise vertically at a fixed location.
label: free-rising balloon

definition: A container filled with a gas that is lighter than air, which is free to drift in the atmosphere.
label: free-floating balloon

definition: A container filled with a gas that is lighter than air, which is tethered at a fixed height and location.
label: tethered balloon

definition: A self-propelled container filled with a gas that is lighter than air.
label: airship

definition: A platform capable of flight in the atmosphere despite its being heavier than air.
label: non-buoyant aircraft

definition: A fixed-wing self-propelled aircraft that is equipped, manned and operated for atmospheric, meteorological or oceanographic research.
label: research aeroplane

definition: A fixed-wing self-propelled aircraft.
label: aeroplane

definition: A rocket is a vehicle, missile or aircraft which obtains thrust by the reaction to the ejection of fast moving exhaust gas from within a rocket engine.
label: rocket

definition: A vehicle operating beyond the Earth's atmosphere without human occupants that orbits the Earth at the same rate as the Earth's rotation keeping it over a fixed location on the Earth's surface..
label: geostationary orbiting satellite

definition: A vehicle operating beyond the Earth's atmosphere without human occupants that orbits the Earth at a different rate to the Earth's rotation so it moves over the Earth's surface..
label: orbiting satellite

definition: A vehicle operating beyond the Earth's atmosphere with human occupants.
label: manned spacecraft

definition: An aircraft without wings that obtains its lift from the rotation of overhead blades.
label: helicopter

definition: A vehicle operating beyond the Earth's atmosphere without human occupants that orbits the Earth.
label: satellite

definition: An aircraft without wings that obtains its lift from the rotation of overhead blades, but obtains forward populsion from a fixed propellor.
label: autogyro

definition: A fixed-wing aircraft with no propulsion.
label: glider

definition: An aerofoil tethered to the ground held aloft by the wind.
label: kite

definition: A fabric sheet designed to slow the descent of an object through the atmosphere.
label: parachute

definition: Any untethered heavier-than-air aircraft that is not occupied by people: may be a remotely piloted aircraft or an autonomous aircraft. Also referred to as a drone.
label: unmanned aerial vehicle

definition: A platform operating beyond the Earth's atmosphere.
label: spacecraft

definition: A living creature carrying instruments or collecting samples.
label: organism

definition: A human being without specialised equipment operating on land or the surface of the water column.
label: human

definition: A human being with self-contained equipment or surface-connected suit enabling operation within the water column.
label: diver

definition: A bird that is unable to fly with the ability to exist within the water column (e.g. penguin).
label: flightless bird

definition: A flighted bird that is able to exist on the water column surface and dive into the water column (e.g. cormorants, auks, ducks and gulls).
label: seabird and duck

definition: A mammal that exists within the water column but needing to regularly surface to breathe (i.e. dolphins and whales).
label: cetacean

definition: A free-swimming creature that exists totally within the water column.
label: fish

definition: A mammal that exists both on land and within the water column. Includes seals, sealions, sea-otters and walruses.
label: land-sea mammals

definition: A frozen body of water on land, freshwater or sea.
label: cryosphere

definition: A floating ice sheet detached from the coast.
label: ice island

definition: A floating ice sheet attached to the coast.
label: ice shelf

definition: Sea ice not connected to land with an ice concentration of over 70 per cent.
label: pack ice

definition: Sea ice not connected to land with an ice concentration of under 70 per cent.
label: drift ice

definition: A self-propelled platform capable of operating on land and within or on the surface of a water body.
label: amphibious vehicle

definition: A self-propelled vehicle capable of operation on land or the seabed (e.g. beach crawler).
label: amphibious crawler

definition: A six-wheel drive amphibious truck developed during the second World War.
label: DUKW

definition: A craft capable of moving over water or land on a downwardly-propelled cushion of air.
label: hovercraft
